etymology.description: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + 韋(韋) (wéi, phonetic) = plant-related character -> berry
etymology.interpretation: The character 莓(莓) (méi, "berry") combines 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass"), which signifies its association with plants, and 韋(韋) (wéi) provides the phonetic component, suggesting the pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 我摘了一些莓(我摘了一些莓)。
春天来临时(春天來臨時)，莓都开始生长(莓都開始生長)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān láilín shí, méi dōu kāishǐ shēngzhǎng.
examples.english: When spring arrives, berries begin to grow.

examples.chinese: 你试试这莓(你試試這莓)，你会爱上它的味道(你會愛上它的味道)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ shì shì zhè méi, nǐ huì ài shàng tā de wèidào.
examples.english: Try this berry, and you'll fall in love with its taste.
